intro: Frasera macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf frasera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas and is often found in mountainous regions. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often larger than those of related species. The plant is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
